trans-unit.source: Facebook as an ACS Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Facebook as an ACS Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Facebook as an ACS Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Facebook as an ACS Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: <token>firstref_acs</token> supports Facebook as an identity provider for web sites and web applications.
trans-unit.target: <token>firstref_acs</token> supports Facebook as an identity provider for web sites and web applications.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> support for Facebook is built using the Facebook Graph API, which enables federated authentication and authorization for Facebook user accounts.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> support for Facebook is built using the Facebook Graph API, which enables federated authentication and authorization for Facebook user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Configuring a prerequisite Facebook application
trans-unit.target: Configuring a prerequisite Facebook application

trans-unit.source: To add Facebook as an identity provider in your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, you must first create a Facebook application and supply it with the necessary parameters to communicate with <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: To add Facebook as an identity provider in your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, you must first create a Facebook application and supply it with the necessary parameters to communicate with <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="749745a9-7b9c-455b-a2c6-575724ba4ea0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="749745a9-7b9c-455b-a2c6-575724ba4ea0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How To: Configure Facebook as an Identity Provider</link>.

trans-unit.source: Configuring with the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Configuring with the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Once your Facebook application is created and you want to add Facebook as an identity provider in the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, you must specify the following settings using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal:
trans-unit.target: Once your Facebook application is created and you want to add Facebook as an identity provider in the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, you must specify the following settings using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Display name</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the display name of your identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Display name</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the display name of your identity provider.

trans-unit.source: This name is used in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal only.
trans-unit.target: This name is used in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal only.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Application ID</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the Application ID that you can copy from your Facebook application.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Application ID</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the Application ID that you can copy from your Facebook application.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Application secret</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the application secret that you can copy from your Facebook Connect application.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Application secret</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the application secret that you can copy from your Facebook Connect application.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Application permissions</embeddedLabel>—Specifies any extended permissions that you want to request from the users of your Facebook application when they log in.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Application permissions</embeddedLabel>—Specifies any extended permissions that you want to request from the users of your Facebook application when they log in.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the permissions that you can request, see <externalLink><linkText>Permissions</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=214014</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=214014).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the permissions that you can request, see <externalLink><linkText>Permissions</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=214014</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=214014).

trans-unit.source: The permission to access Facebook users' email addresses is provided by default and additional permissions must be delimited by commas.
trans-unit.target: The permission to access Facebook users' email addresses is provided by default and additional permissions must be delimited by commas.

trans-unit.source: Once permissions are configured, your relying party application can use the issued Facebook access token to request the additional user information using the Facebook Graph API.
trans-unit.target: Once permissions are configured, your relying party application can use the issued Facebook access token to request the additional user information using the Facebook Graph API.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Access Token claim type in <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7#BKMK_8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Supported claim types</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Access Token claim type in <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7#BKMK_8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Supported claim types</link>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Login link text</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the text that is displayed for the Facebook identity provider on the login page of your web application.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Login link text</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the text that is displayed for the Facebook identity provider on the login page of your web application.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Image URL (optional)</embeddedLabel>—Specifies a URL to an image file (for example, a logo of your choice) that you can display as the login link for this identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Image URL (optional)</embeddedLabel>—Specifies a URL to an image file (for example, a logo of your choice) that you can display as the login link for this identity provider.

trans-unit.source: This logo automatically appears on the default login page for your <token>secondref_acs</token>-aware web application, as well as in your web application’s JSON feed that you can use to render a custom login page.
trans-unit.target: This logo automatically appears on the default login page for your <token>secondref_acs</token>-aware web application, as well as in your web application’s JSON feed that you can use to render a custom login page.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify an image URL, then a text login link for this identity provider is displayed on the login page of your web application.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify an image URL, then a text login link for this identity provider is displayed on the login page of your web application.

trans-unit.source: If you specify an image URL, it is strongly recommended that it be pointed to a trusted source, for example, your own web site or application, using HTTPS to prevent browser security warnings.
trans-unit.target: If you specify an image URL, it is strongly recommended that it be pointed to a trusted source, for example, your own web site or application, using HTTPS to prevent browser security warnings.

trans-unit.source: Also, any image that is larger than 240 pixels in width and 40 pixels in height is automatically resized on the default ACS home realm discovery page.
trans-unit.target: Also, any image that is larger than 240 pixels in width and 40 pixels in height is automatically resized on the default ACS home realm discovery page.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Relying party application</embeddedLabel>—Specifies all existing relying party applications that you want to associate with the Facebook identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Relying party application</embeddedLabel>—Specifies all existing relying party applications that you want to associate with the Facebook identity provider.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: After an identity provider is associated with a relying party application, rules for that identity provider must be generated or added manually in a relying party application’s rule group to complete the configuration.
trans-unit.target: After an identity provider is associated with a relying party application, rules for that identity provider must be generated or added manually in a relying party application’s rule group to complete the configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: Supported claim types
trans-unit.target: Supported claim types

trans-unit.source: After a user authenticates with an identity provider, they receive a token populated with identity claims.
trans-unit.target: After a user authenticates with an identity provider, they receive a token populated with identity claims.

trans-unit.source: Claims are pieces of information about the user, such as an email address or a unique ID.
trans-unit.target: Claims are pieces of information about the user, such as an email address or a unique ID.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> can pass these claims directly through to the relying party application, or make authorization decisions based on the values they contain.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> can pass these claims directly through to the relying party application, or make authorization decisions based on the values they contain.

trans-unit.source: By default, claim types in <token>secondref_acs</token> are uniquely identified using a URI for compliance with the SAML token specification.
trans-unit.target: By default, claim types in <token>secondref_acs</token> are uniquely identified using a URI for compliance with the SAML token specification.

trans-unit.source: These URIs are also used to identify claims in other token formats.
trans-unit.target: These URIs are also used to identify claims in other token formats.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the claim types that are available to <token>secondref_acs</token> for Facebook identity providers.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the claim types that are available to <token>secondref_acs</token> for Facebook identity providers.

trans-unit.source: Claim Type
trans-unit.target: Claim Type

trans-unit.source: URI
trans-unit.target: URI

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name Identifier
trans-unit.target: Name Identifier

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier

trans-unit.source: A unique identifier (uid) for the user account, provided by Facebook.
trans-unit.target: A unique identifier (uid) for the user account, provided by Facebook.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/name
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/name

trans-unit.source: The display name for the user account, provided by Facebook.
trans-unit.target: The display name for the user account, provided by Facebook.

trans-unit.source: Email Address
trans-unit.target: Email Address

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress

trans-unit.source: The email address for the user account, provided by Facebook.
trans-unit.target: The email address for the user account, provided by Facebook.

trans-unit.source: Note that this claim type is only provided if “email” is configured as an application permission, which it is by default in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Note that this claim type is only provided if “email” is configured as an application permission, which it is by default in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Access Token
trans-unit.target: Access Token

trans-unit.source: http://www.facebook.com/claims/AccessToken
trans-unit.target: http://www.facebook.com/claims/AccessToken

trans-unit.source: The Facebook OAuth 2.0 access token for the current user session.
trans-unit.target: The Facebook OAuth 2.0 access token for the current user session.

trans-unit.source: This access token can be used to make calls back to Facebook using the Graph API.
trans-unit.target: This access token can be used to make calls back to Facebook using the Graph API.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Graph API</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=214018</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Graph API</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=214018</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Expiration
trans-unit.target: Expiration

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2008/06/identity/claims/expiration
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2008/06/identity/claims/expiration

trans-unit.source: The date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) at which the access token expires.
trans-unit.target: The date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) at which the access token expires.

trans-unit.source: This claim type is not present if the <userInput>offline_access</userInput> permission is requested.
trans-unit.target: This claim type is not present if the <userInput>offline_access</userInput> permission is requested.

trans-unit.source: Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.microsoft.com/accesscontrolservice/2010/07/claims/IdentityProvider
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.microsoft.com/accesscontrolservice/2010/07/claims/IdentityProvider

trans-unit.source: A claim provided by <token>secondref_acs</token> that tells the relying party application that the user authenticated using a particular Facebook application.
trans-unit.target: A claim provided by <token>secondref_acs</token> that tells the relying party application that the user authenticated using a particular Facebook application.

trans-unit.source: The format of this claim value is Facebook-<placeholder><Application ID></placeholder>, and the actual value is visible in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal via the <ui>Realm</ui> field on the <ui>Edit Identity Provider</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: The format of this claim value is Facebook-<placeholder><Application ID></placeholder>, and the actual value is visible in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal via the <ui>Realm</ui> field on the <ui>Edit Identity Provider</ui> page.
